Reviews.Title: “traveller. don't”
Reviews.Author: edie c
Reviews.Content: o.k for the price but don't expect too much.Remember you get what you pay for!!

Reviews.Title: “Charming B&B over a bar”
Reviews.Author: DebP123
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice bed and breakfast located in the Rocks area. It is above a bar and at night it can be somewhat noisy when trying to sleep. My daughter who is a very light sleeper didn't like this but I had no difficulty falling asleep. You have to carry your suitcases up a staircase to get to the 2nd floor. The staff helped us carry our luggage up and kept them for us on departure so that we could go shopping for a few hours before our flight. Breakfast consists of toast, yoghurt, cereal, fruit and was a typical continental breakfast. On the rare occasion that I had a question, the staff were very helpful in answering them. The price is very good when compared to the cost of other lodgings in this area.

Reviews.Title: “A must stop while visiting Australia”
Reviews.Author: RikkiP
Reviews.Content: Everything about this dining venue creates memorable experiences Indoors and outdoors the restaurant is packed with friendly crowds sampling the 100 Australian beers and enjoying the food. And, the food is so good. The Kangaroo pizza is a must. It is not just some novelty for foreigners to sample but a culinary masterpiece. So good, we had to return a second time to get our fill before leaving for America. We also tried the saltwater croc pizza, peking duck and veal sausage which were one of a kind..

Reviews.Title: “Not pretending to be anything their not”
Reviews.Author: lonelytraveller101
Reviews.Content: Just a quick comment on the accomodation at the Australian Hotel, noticed other reviews complaining, if you want silver service go to the hilton but if your after good friendly atmosphere and a historic venue then you have come to the right place. The australian is a little slice of history with the pub being almost 100 years old of course you will find some paint peeling or no a/c but thats what you come for, somewhere not sterile or cold with some character and warmth where the staff are friendly and are happy to do anything for you, to be reminded of a time long forgotten now days, if thats what your after you have found it. To the people complaining i say go to a 4 star hotel and leave the australian to the real travellers seeking good quality accomodation and friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: Geri D
Reviews.Content: You must have a frame of reference...everything in AU is expensive (except public transportation). So, the best thing I can say about this hotel is that it was the least expensive I could find, outside of a hostel. The second best thing is the historical location in The Rocks. It is a primary tourist location and a short walk to the Quay, CBD, Harbour Bridge and the Opera House. There is also free wifi available thru the pub downstairs, but you really need to use a small sitting room downstairs or one of the sidewalk tables. For this price in the U.S., we would get a pretty nice place, but, this is not the U.S. So, here is the down side of this place. Very tiny room...there is actually not enough space in the room for two people to unpack and store some items. No a/c...not a huge problem if it is cool. But, it was hot and humid. And, when you open the window, there was no cross ventilation, so it stayed hot. Then you have to deal with street and pub noise from downstairs. Finally, all rooms are on the 2nd floor and there is no lift. My husband struggled to get our luggage up the very narrow, winding staircase. But, the man who checked us in was very nice to help. In the U.S., we rarely get a room w/o a bathroom, so you would have to feel comfortable going down the hall. There were however, several bathrooms, so it was not a problem getting in one. Generally, this hotel, altough an historic landmark, is very old and not well taken care of (stained carpets, cracked tiles, torn curtains). Having given you all the negatives, I would stay there again if it was below 20 Celsius. The reason is that we are generally gone all day sight seeing, and spend very little time in the room. It could be right for the right traveler, but not one used to the Four Seasons! You just have to know what you are getting into, understand that you get what you pay for, and not forget your earplugs.

Reviews.Title: “Great bar; get a beer passport and drink 100!”
Reviews.Author: InstantKiwi
Reviews.Content: I recommend that you try the Australian beers on tap. Fantastic atmosphere, but a little crowded when tying to find a dinner table. The menu was good: salt water croc pizza was nice

Reviews.Title: “Stay away”
Reviews.Author: Julievogel
Reviews.Content: Dirty smelly mouldy rooms Rooftop terrace full of hazards, staff unfriendly, breakfast stale! Yuck!!! Stay at hostel next door much cheaper and heaps cleaner We will not be back! Disgusting!

Reviews.Title: “Great Beer Selection & Pizza”
Reviews.Author: Karetomuch
Reviews.Content: Want to try pizza with crocodile or kangaroo or duck or pork belly/apple that has been perfectly matched with a beer selection then you must go here! Our group has tried each of these and additionally the Queensland- bacon, pineapple and tomatoes and each was delicious. Very casual dining- sit outside and visit with friends. Purchase drinks and food at bar and wait for food to be delivered to tables. Small pizzas for one person. Pricing was good for food and quality.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel business is not their priority”
Reviews.Author: JerichoNomad
Reviews.Content: We spent 6 nights at this hotel, and can state that clearly the hotel is not the priority of this owner - the restaurant downstairs is. The "reception desk" is never manned, so you're always searching for staff. Though the place was almost empty the week we were there, and there were tons of double rooms, they put us in the smallest room I have ever stayed in, and that compares to some real shoe boxes I've slept in before. We were charged the right price at check in, but one of the managers got confused, and we came back on our second-to-last day to find most of our belongings gone from our room and someone else moved in. They had bundled up most of our stuff and put it in bags in the housekeeping room, thinking we were moving out. When we finally won the argument that our booking was right, we were put in a lovely double room twice the size of where we were before. What a mess. No apology, and terrible service. Pros: Housekeeping does a very good job. Rooms and bathrooms are kept clean. Nice breakfast included. The Rocks location is a really close walk to CBD, Opera House, and Harbour Bridge. Cons: No management. Noise from the bar downstairs, as well as lots of early morning bottle sweeping. No air con (understandable, as it's an old place) but the noise made opening windows unpleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Charming, but I only went there to eat Kangaroo pizza:)”
Reviews.Author: BfromUSA
Reviews.Content: This review is merely for the atmosphere and the kangaroo pizza. I didn't stay at the actual hotel. Very charming decor and atmosphere and the kangaroo pizza was crazy good. Your best seat is outside sipping a good brew and munching on pizza watching the people and cars pass by. Good location and neat how it's set up, like a little island corner, outside seating all around... A little pricey, but most everything is more expensive in Australia:) Good food and good fun!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient”
Reviews.Author: Anicacosta
Reviews.Content: We found this place on lastinute.com it had a comfortable bed, plenty of showers and toilets, and a cute breaky in the morning. Staff were all very helpful. We're planning on going back.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic value for money in the Rocks”
Reviews.Author: docchill
Reviews.Content: The Australian is full of character and great value for money. The central location in the Rocks is second to none and the rooms are comfortable and quirky. Like most traditional Australian "pubs" the bathrooms are not ensuite but this is more than made up for by the friendly welcome and comfy sitting room area with complimentary sherry, tea and coffee

Reviews.Title: “A great location in the heart of the city with everything within walking distance”
Reviews.Author: TenterfieldTraveller
Reviews.Content: A great location in the heart of the city with everything within walking distance, especially the historic Rocks area and Circular Quay. I was amazed at the price for what we got, compared to the 5 star one up the road where Iâ€™ve also stayed. Give me interesting and funky every time! The rooms are a decent size and the shared facilities are clean and well kept. One bathroom is totally new, while retaining old-world charm. (I found 5 bathrooms with toilets/ or toilets by my third day there). Music rocks downstairs for a while at night but the floor was thick enough to reduce that a lot. The common rooms are lovely old style Victoriana, complete with a chess set, complimentary sherry, and a bowl full of good quality fruit. Itâ€™s a good place to meet people including experienced travellers with lots of travel-tips, free wifi during the day, tea, coffee, juices and cornflakes for brekky, and books and magazines galore. Nice bar and restaurant downstairs, great to hang out in the evenings, a lot of young people. Definitely a cosmopolitan, young and meet-people place to be, for city explorers. This is a hotel where you can ask for what you need. Just a mention of my dairy intolerance produced an alternative for me â€“ on the house â€“ within 5 mins. Others had food delivered to their rooms. The commom room cleaning staff were warm and helpful but not on duty 24/7. Hence if there are lots of guests hanging out together in the evening, theyâ€™ll use up all the mugs and sherry glasses, so you may have to wash out a mug if you get up early before the cleaning staff arrive. We all know the answer to that problem is to go pay for the 5-star up the street. The aesthetic charm and the hospitality in this place is legend in my view.

Reviews.Title: “plenty of character, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: libby552
Reviews.Content: A lively pub, helpful staff, clean, comfortable rooms and a wonderful collection of Australian photos and memorabilia give this hotel a friendly atmosphere. A simple breakfast is included, and the common room is a perfect spot to relax in comfort, in the morning sun, or with a glass of wine in the evenings. Shared bathrooms are well-maintained. A great, traditional pub in an excellent location to explore The Rocks area and city attractions. Will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Bunnings8
Reviews.Content: If you can put up with the noise then this is the place to stay great location Pizzas are the best Little Creatures Beer fantastic

Reviews.Title: “Nice and busy sort of hostel style place.”
Reviews.Author: Evy H
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel while searching for a restaurant and during our trip stayed there 2 times while passing sydney. The rooms are not ensuite, but lovely and old fashioned furnished. There are plenty of bathrooms though so you will always manage to find an empty one to use. The common room is lovely old style victorian furnished, with chess, complimentary congnac and cherry, and apples. Very good place to meet people, free wifi during the day, small breakfast (tea, coffee, juices and cornflakes provided) books and magazines. Nice bar and restaurant downstairs, great to hang out in the evenings, a lot of young people. Quite noise on weekends (also weekend the price is a little higher), nice staff and we were able to store bags there for a week (until we were flying back from our trip). great location directly on the rocks, at the bridge. Definitely a cosmopolitan, young and meet-people place to be, for city explorers, great pub/food lovers. We ll be back for sure. Ps roomservice available. Staff brought restaurant food up to the room, or to the common room!

Reviews.Title: “Traditional Pub Accomodation”
Reviews.Author: cgle2282
Reviews.Content: It is hard to find traditional pub accomodation in the city these days. The kind of pub where the publican used to sleep upstairs. This is it. A great location in the heart of the city with everything within walking distance. The rooms are decent in size and the shared facilities are clean and well kept. As can be expected, a bit of noise on the weekends but a midnight closing time for the pub downstairs is more than acceptable and part of the package. If you want 5 star, there are plenty of options in the city. If you want to stay above the pub, then this is it. Great pizza downstairs as well!

Reviews.Title: “What a great location & a very authentic hotel accommodation experience”
Reviews.Author: bek1712
Reviews.Content: We came to stay at the Aussie Hotel for a weekend after a recommendation from some friends who had stayed there earlier this year. The hotel is very much a part of Aussie History and the character, authentic and charming attributes may not be for everyone but it ticked all our boxes. The rooms are a reasonable size, clean and tidy with shared facilities, a number of bathrooms and only 9 rooms so no long waits etc. The real positives; the location right in the heart of the Rocks area, great pub downstairs with a fantastic selection of beers and amazing pizzas, along with all of the staff being extremely welcoming and the little things like complimentary breakfast, the fresh apples, the sherry and port for a nightcap add to make this a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and we'll back!”
Reviews.Author: watkinsdoesaus
Reviews.Content: We were so pleased to find this little hidden gem in The Rocks. Centrally located to everywhere and within walking distance, we didnt use public transport at all! The hotel is historic which adds to the quiant and rustic charm in the accommodation area. Wonderful character which reminds me of staying at my grandmothers house. Definitely value for money! We'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “A Nightmare not a Holiday: Dirty and noisy”
Reviews.Author: Smartchoices
Reviews.Content: I stayed 2 out of the 4 nights booked and then left disgusted. I was tired of seeing dried faeces on the toilet bowl in one of the shared bathroom and realised the dead cockroach on the floor would never be removed. I did clean the toilet myself on the first day as it was full of surprises. Our room was not cleaned during our stay. The noise from the pub started at 11am and stopped at midnight - no soundproofing of the rooms. This is an extremely poor choice for a budget stay. I would not recommend this hotel under any circumstance if you respect your sanity.

Reviews.Title: “Bring your ear plugs, or better still bring the phone number for another hotel.”
Reviews.Author: lkl255068
Reviews.Content: The rooms are situated above a noisy pub with pavement dining. Consequently you won't get any sleep and the carpeted wooden floor was vibrating from the speaker directly below - no kidding. Your wakeup call is the pub workers turning the music back on at 7.30 am while they ready for another day of drinkers. There is one bathroom incorporating toilet (not separate) shared across all rooms. I found a dirty sock under the bed. The carpet was filthy. The breakfast crockery was dirty. No bedside table or lamp to read by. No private TV (but you wouldn't have been able to hear it anyway!). There was a smoke detector but no sprinkler. My bet is that this hotel is not seeking return guests. Stay at the YHA up the road, and have the same experience for half the price.

Reviews.Title: “What some may expect, others do not”
Reviews.Author: oceangirl4618
Reviews.Content: The Australian is a rustic city pub hotel. The location in the Rocks was great. The room size was good. The bed was good. The toilets and showers were clean but they were shared between all the guests. Breakfast was simple but good and filling. The furnishings were "very well loved" and had been "well used." This does not mean they were bad but that some may have different expectations of appearance. I was perfectly comfortable and happy staying here, but my traveling companion was not. The things I saw as rustic and homey, she saw as run-down and not well-kept. I would recommend this lovely place to people who are looking for an inexpensive room where you can get a good, simple breakfast, a good, hearty dinner and great night's sleep. If you are looking for super crisp and clean, this older rustic hotel might not be what you are looking for.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy & Needs Cleaning!”
Reviews.Author: LMP10
Reviews.Content: This place was quaint and the location was fantastic. The overall value for the location in Sydney was good. However, the place was just dirty. I understand flaking paint for a place this old but the dust, filth and grime was inexcusable. The carpet was heavily stained and everything in the room and common rooms looked like they needed a deep cleaning, there were layers of dust everywhere. Another downside was the noise from the downstairs pub, while is wasn't extremely bad - we used earplugs. Overall they did a good job with amenities with fresh towels in each room with decorative soaps on each one; they had soap, shampoo, hairdryers and a continental breakfast that was good. So this place had everything a person would want if only it was clean. Since the value for the location was good I am not sure if I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Best location ever and amazing value!”
Reviews.Author: whalebnb
Reviews.Content: For only $69 a double this Hotel represented amazing value. It was quiet on a midweek night and we slept well. It had the charm of yesteryear and fitted in beautifully in it's location in The Rocks. The Lounge area was lovely and breakfast was thrown in too. I don't think anyone should complain at this price.

Reviews.Title: “BAD, BAD, BAD”
Reviews.Author: loyola1
Reviews.Content: Overall very poor experience. Greated by someone working at the bar who seemed to care less that they had rooms upstairs. Loud and drunk people wondering upstairs at night. Room was not cleaned one of the days. Stay away.

Reviews.Title: “Awful end to a perfect day”
Reviews.Author: MahonDY
Reviews.Content: Stayed there with extended family from overseas after my daughter's wedding. Thought it would be a treat for them to be right in the heart of the Rocks. My partner had booked in earlier in the day - unfortunately was in a hurry as we were on our way to the wedding. What can I say - I am sure the sheets had been slept on before, the bed was shoddily made. The bathroom and toilet smelt very unpleasant. The bar fridge in the breakfast area was a health hazard. Dead flowers on the breakfast table. Very Faulty Towers. Couldn't wait to get out of there. This place used to be so quaint and I have stayed there on and off for the last few years. What's happened? To the credit of the management, when we voiced our complaint, 75% of our tariff was returned to us. Request to management and owners - spend some money and clean it up.

Reviews.Title: “A quintessential Aussie pub experience”
Reviews.Author: dooragan
Reviews.Content: Let's start by acknowledging this style of accommodation isn't for everyone. You're far more likely to find true travelers here rather than your average tourist. The Australian Heritage Hotel is a pretty good example of what is sadly becoming an increasingly difficult to find style of classic Aussie accommodation.....the pub. While certainly not unique, Australian pubs are different to those found in other parts of the world. A little worn and tattered around the edges, minimal facilities (typically have shared bathrooms) and sometimes prone to be noisy, they are invariably cheap. If you are looking for a quintessentially Aussie experience, it's worth staying at least a night or two to really understand what this style of accommodation is all about. If however you want an ensuite, pillow-top beds, big buffet breakfast, flat screen television and sterile conditions, there are Holiday Inns, Radissons, Hiltons or Best Westerns about 1km away. This 12 'guest' room B&B style pub gives travelers the chance to experience how it was in the 1920's and 30's in Sydney. While not located in the absolute heart of the city, the pub is in the historic Rocks area, practically on the harbour. OK, so if you look behind the facade, she's starting to show her age (just shy of her 100th birthday) but so long as you acknowledge this is a pub after all, you will find the experience is quite enjoyable, offering as it does a great location, pretty comfortable surroundings and an experience that true travelers often crave and actively seek out. I've stayed here a few times now and may have simply been lucky, but I've yet to have a bad experience. I've never had problems with bugs, excessive noise from either the bar downstairs or the street and the bathrooms have always been clean and available. The free (included) continental breakfast is available 24/7 and while basic (three cereals, milk, toast, jams, tea, coffe and fruit) it's laid out in a pleasant common room which also has a TV and chess table. You can even have a free Port in the evening. Free Internet is also acessible here although strangely only between 0500-1900.....go figure? There are plenty of tour brochures and the Airport shuttle can be booked - it will take you to the airport for AU$14 each. It's a pretty good option as it's an awkward 800 metre walk to the train station lugging your luggage up a number of stairs on the way. There is a kitchen and larger dining room up the hall with a fridge, oven, cooktop and other equipment if you choose to self cater....although with so many great dining options within a very short walk, why would you bother? Check out the roof top balcony - a nice place to enjoy your cold beer from the bar downstairs. The hotel is less than one kilometre from Circular Quay and even closer to the stairs up onto the Harbour Bridge. A really nice option is to take an early morning walk up and over the bridge on the eastern side returning on the western side from Milson's Point for a different perspective (about an hour). Alteratively you can walk down through the Rocks and around the Quay to the Opera House and onto the Botanical Gardens. The key to getting the most out of a stay at the Australian is to remember it's a pub, its old, it's cheap (I've never paid more than AU$80) it's basic, the paint may be peeling and its quite likely to be a little noisy. The up side is that it provides an increasingly rare and uniquely Aussie experience in the historic heart of Sydney for a pretty reasonable price. Enjoy the opportunity while you can, as these places are fast disappearing.

Reviews.Title: “We can not say a bad thing”
Reviews.Author: happycamperNsw
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel on Saturday 21 November 2009 in a queen room (room 5), and we can not fault the accomadation in any way. Our room was clean and well presented and equiped. The shared bathrooms were also very clean. The staff at the hotel we found to be really friendly and helpful. Yes the accomadation/pub is old looking, a little run down and has that old smell but thats what happens when the place is over a 100 years old and yes it is not a 5 star hotel but it is a great place to stay which is very central to everything. We only paid $65Aus (through lastminute.com.au) for the night and we had friend that were paying $150aus elsewhere and our accomadation was so much better and it included breakfast. What more could you want. I must admit i was a bit worried when i was reading the other reveiws, but i can honestly say we do not agree with any of there comments. So if you are looking for somewhere to stay that is cheap,clean and close to the everything I WOULD RECOMMEND THIS PLACE.

Reviews.Title: “Careful of the Pizza”
Reviews.Author: Warning4u
Reviews.Content: My husband and I ate at the Pub's cafe. He had a Moroccan Lamb pizza and has been vomitting and had diarrhea for 2 days since. I had a taste of it on the night and it seemed alright but I felt nauseous the following morning and also thought I might throw up. Don't bother ringing the staff about problems with the food. It just adds insult to the injury. They couldn't give a damn. A rotten experience all in all. I would think seriously before eating anything at this place. A holiday is no fun with food poisoning.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting”
Reviews.Author: kingchivas
Reviews.Content: I have to agree with alot of the other reviewers. This place markets itself as a nice antique place, but it is really not kept in a good state. The rooms were not very clean as was the rest of the hotel. But the most impressive, was at night when I went to shower in the common bathrooms, I was met by the biggest cockroaches I had ever seen. I went ot another of the bathrooms to find the same sight! When I spoke about this to the staff, the kindly came up and put some sort of bug spray telling me this was normal because "the Rocks are a very old part of town and are infested with these bugs". They seem to get these all the time... I dont need to tell you that I did not spend a second night in this place...

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: WiltshireBagpuss
Reviews.Content: The only good thing about this accommodation is the location. The whole place needs a good clean. Rooms are not serviced- beds not made, towel (only one provided) not changed. The furniture is tatty and certainly not 'antique'. The curtain pole in our room was held up at one end by a belt tied to a vent in the wall. One small heater is provided and the rooms are not air conditioned. The music in the pub beneath the accommodation was loud and played until 2.45am on both the nights we stayed and restarted at 8.15am. None of the rooms are en-suite. Tea, coffee and breakfast (toast, cereal & yogurt) are provided in a common area on a help yourself basis. Tried a pizza from the pub - have had better Would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “In need of tlc”
Reviews.Author: NottinghamEleanor
Reviews.Content: This is backpacker accomodation masquerading as a boutique hotel. The website photos and talk of antique furniture gives a somewhat flattering description. The furniture was antique but it was very tatty . The rooms are small and the beds extremely creaky.The bathrooms were also unattractively antique ie nasty stains on the bath etc! Overall the standard of cleanilness was very poor . We stayed there for 3 nights and didn't get our room serviced once or clean towels/linen which considering how hot it was whilst we were staying there wasn't good! At no time did we ever see a cleaner in our entire stay ! That said the atmosphere was quirky and it is in a great location. If I had paid backpcker prices I would have probably rated it as reasonable value but at the prices it charges I would expect more . You are paying premium rates for the priviledge of staying in the Rocks! Suffice to say on our return to Sydney we opted to stay elsewhere!

HotelInfo.Name: The Australian Heritage Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 100 Cumberland Street | The Rocks, Sydney, New South Wales 2000, Australia
